009package Ch13_Color_Images;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
018import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
019import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
020
021import java.util.Arrays;
022
023import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
024
025/**
026 * <p>
027 * ImageJ plugin, counts the distinct colors in the current color image. See Sec. 13.3 (Prog. 13.10) of [1] for
028 * details.
029 * </p>
030 * <p>
031 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
032 * (2022).
033 * </p>
034 *
035 * @author WB
036 * @see IjUtils#countColors(ColorProcessor)
037 */
038public class Count_Colors implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
039
040        /**
041         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
042         */
043        public Count_Colors() {
044                if (noCurrentImage()) {
045                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.Flower);
046                }
047        }
048        
049        @Override
050        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
051                return DOES_RGB + NO_CHANGES;
052        }
053
054        @Override
055        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
056                int n = countColors((ColorProcessor) ip);
057                IJ.showMessage("Image has " + n + " unique colors.");
058        }
059
060        /**
061         * Determines how many different colors are contained in the specified 24 bit full-color RGB image. Replicated from
062         * {@link IjUtils#countColors(ColorProcessor)}.
063         *
064         * @param cp a RGB image
065         * @return the number of distinct colors
066         */
067        protected int countColors (ColorProcessor cp) {
068                // duplicate pixel array and sort
069                int[] pixels = (int[]) cp.getPixelsCopy();
070                Arrays.sort(pixels);  
071                
072                int k = 1;      // image contains at least one color
073                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length - 1; i++) {
074                        if (pixels[i] != pixels[i + 1])
075                                k = k + 1;
076                }
077                return k;
078        }
079
080}
